params.amount: Amount of settlement tokens to add
params.marketId: The market to add liquidity to

params.amountIn: Amount of settlement tokens to spend
params.isYes: True to buy YES, false to buy NO

params.marketId: The market to claim fees from

params.question: The question being predicted
params.resolutionTime: When the market can be resolved (Unix timestamp)

returns.marketId: The ID of the created market

returns.claimableAmount: Amount of fees the user can claim

params.isYes: True for YES price, false for NO price
True for YES, false for NO

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

params.marketId: The market to remove liquidity from
params.noAmount: Amount of NO tokens to burn
params.yesAmount: Amount of YES tokens to burn

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

addLiquidity(uint256,uint256).notice: Add liquidity to a market (receive YES + NO tokens)

claimLiquidityProviderFees(uint256).notice: Claim accumulated liquidity provider fees without removing liquidity

forceResolveMarket(uint256,uint8).notice: Force resolve a market immediately (oracle only) - for testing/demo purposes

getClaimableLiquidityProviderFees(uint25.notice: Get how much fees a user can claim from a market

getSharePrice(uint256,bool).notice: Get current price of YES or NO shares

getSharesOut(uint256,bool,uint256).notice: Calculate shares received for a given input amount

removeLiquidity(uint256,uint256,uint256).notice: Remove liquidity from a market (burn YES + NO tokens)
